questionTitle: Which of the following correctly describes the following figure?
questionExplanation: Capacity planning measures the maximum amount of work that can be done using the current technology and then adds resources to do more work as needed.

questionOption1: Capacity planning seeks to match demand to available resources
questionOption2: Capacity planning examines what systems are in place, measures their performance, and determines patterns in usage that enables the planner to predict demand
questionOption3: Resources are provisioned and allocated to meet demand
questionExplanation: Performance tuning and optimization is not a primary goal of capacity planners.

questionTitle: What is the relation of the capacity attribute to performance?
questionExplanation: With capacity, you are concerned about how much work a system can do, whereas with performance, you are concerned with the rate at which work gets done.
